results.content:
Kalob is one of the best instructors I have had in all my 80 years. He explains and demonstrates in great detail and in small pieces, and then has his students practice that little piece. Gradually, he builds up the pieces into bigger pieces in the practices. 

So many instructors do the opposite - they talk and demonstrate a whole ton of things and then give a practice to include all of that. The result is usually one of confusion and frustration on the part of students because it is too hard to put so many things together when you are just beginning. You have difficulty figuring out what is causing the whole thing not to work properly - is it one thing or is it a combination of mistakes.

Kalob - you are a natural teacher - and such people don't come along all the time. Congratulations on your organization, demonstrations, explanations, and practices. Great job!!!
results.content_html:

results.content:
DO NOT BUY THIS COURSE!

This is a good course in CSS, but I took off stars for its poor value, and you should not buy it.  I'll explain why below.

Kalob has lots of courses on Udemy, but he has also combined several of those courses (including this one) into a larger course called "The Complete 2020 Fullstack Web Developer Course", which is the same price as each of the other courses on their own (at least they're the same price when Udemy does their sales several times a month)!  So you can buy lots of Kalob's courses and pay a price for each, or you can buy those courses combined and pay the same price that you'd pay for 1 course alone!  It's really a no-brainer, if only I had seen that full course before I bought this one separately.  In case anybody is thinking it, I am not within Udemy's 30-day refund window anymore.

results.content:
The course is good. It teaches real good stuff. 
Two things though that you have to know.
1st it doesnt include grid. I dont know if it is a must in 2020 but the course does not mention anything about the grid.
2nd is that I would like more real world examples. Ie why not how to create a responsive drop down menu or a navigation bar that shrinks for phones. Or a complete landing page etc. I want to believe that this material will be added in future updates.

results.content: This is a very easy question to answer. I love this instructor,  having taken courses from him in the beginning of my journey of web development. I already know he's a great teacher and takes the time to spell everything out for his students. He makes no assumptions as to your knowledge of the subject he's teaching and apologizes for those who many feel offended by his taking the time out for us newbies. And still gets on with the lesson at hand, it's nice to be considered. Mr. Kalob I feel is a great instructor to learn anything from and I look forward to learning more,  in greater detail of what he's already taught me.

results.content:
This course is a good match for me.  All good so far.

My early part of the course feedback would be that if, as I did, you already took Kalob's HTML5 course there is some repetition at the beginning of material that was covered in that course like basic CSS syntax and examples and picking an editor.
Student time could be saved by simply saying "If you did my HTML5 course then I covered this already, so you can skip over lectures 2, 3 and 4 (or whatever) - but that's only at the very beginning.

I've found the course excellent as it's gone on further.  There sure is a lot of CSS to learn - but Kalob makes a good job of getting us through it.
I think the one thing I found most difficult was estimating how long it would take me to do the course.  I allowed about 3 x the video time, but that proved a significant under-estimate.  This is a problem if you are working to a deadline (as I am) and have told my boss I need 3 days to do the course.  Hofstadter's law proves itself once again.

It might be a help to people who have learned CSS but not CSS3 to give some guidance as to which lessons will cover the CSS3 "new stuff".

I found I needed about 4 times as long as the video time to do the course (and I skipped some exercises and cranked up the playback speed in places, in order to get through the material)


A really good course. Kalob you are a really excellence teacher.
results.content_html:

A really good course. Kalob you are a really excellence teacher.

results.content:
This course was taken to upgrade my skills that for the past few years have been dedicated to keeping legacy applications running and expanding their functionality. This course has been a good start at understanding what can be done to build modern web sites that deal with the wide variety of devices that cruise the Internet. 

One thing that I would recommend to improve the experience  of the course is to provide the student with wireframes for some of the larger tasks. In all of the development that I have undertaken, I always created visual representations of what was to be created so that I knew the end goal.  While there are people that can work from a blank canvas, it helpful went you set a task is to show the person what result is expected. I think a larger task at the end of the course would be beneficial.

results.content: I bought two courses in the beginning because I didn't trust that this course could deliver based on the introduction video. I wanted to build a project with the instructor and MAYBE learn something(I know, lazy). However, by focusing more on me and less on the "project approach" I realized that this course was EXACTLY what I was looking for. I ended refunding the other course after completing just 4% of it because by then I felt having it was just pointless. This is the GO TO COURSE if you want no bs and crystal clear information. This course is not for you if you're lazy though. The instructor is laid back and that might work against someone who is lazy. But heck, even then you might learn something. Bottom line: do the exercises and just pay attention. I'm glad I took this course and not the other one. WORTH IT!
results.content_html: I bought two courses in the beginning because I didn't trust that this course could deliver based on the introduction video. I wanted to build a project with the instructor and MAYBE learn something(I know, lazy). However, by focusing more on me and less on the "project approach" I realized that this course was EXACTLY what I was looking for. I ended refunding the other course after completing just 4% of it because by then I felt having it was just pointless. This is the GO TO COURSE if you want no bs and crystal clear information. This course is not for you if you're lazy though. The instructor is laid back and that might work against someone who is lazy. But heck, even then you might learn something. Bottom line: do the exercises and just pay attention. I'm glad I took this course and not the other one. WORTH IT!

results.content: The course comprehensive and the instructor is both informative and engaging. I particularly like the included CSS Masterclass ebook. Importantly, this class is foundational, helping students to learn how to create elements that can be used in any project rather than based on the needs of a specific project. I would like to see more complexity in the flex box and responsive design sections but a tremendous course overall. Five stars without reservation!
results.content_html: The course comprehensive and the instructor is both informative and engaging. I particularly like the included CSS Masterclass ebook. Importantly, this class is foundational, helping students to learn how to create elements that can be used in any project rather than based on the needs of a specific project. I would like to see more complexity in the flex box and responsive design sections but a tremendous course overall. Five stars without reservation!

results.content: An absolutely amazing course. It took my CSS skills to a new level. I was a beginner when I started and thanks to this course and some additional reading, now I make sense of most of CSS3. I definitely recommend this course to anyone interested in the topic. Having completed the whole course I am ready to dive deeper in the world of web development and programming.

results.content: Course Topics are very short. Lots of info is skipped over. Leaves a lot of unknowns. e.g. Showed how to create an outline around box model, but did not show how to use the outline-offset to place space between an outline and the edge/border of an element. I feel this property is very important. I knew there had to be one and so I googled it. Anyway, that is not the only thing. He covers topics toooooooooo fast.  In previous chapter, the topic of the selector, id, class are gone over so fast, he never explains anything about them and there difference. He just places a period or hashmark in front and leaves us to wonder!!!!!  Very poooorrrrrr teaching. I have only gotten through two chapters and I have a sour taste in my mouth about this course. I have already looked to see if there was another one by another instructor
results.content_html: Course Topics are very short. Lots of info is skipped over. Leaves a lot of unknowns. e.g. Showed how to create an outline around box model, but did not show how to use the outline-offset to place space between an outline and the edge/border of an element. I feel this property is very important. I knew there had to be one and so I googled it. Anyway, that is not the only thing. He covers topics toooooooooo fast. In previous chapter, the topic of the selector, id, class are gone over so fast, he never explains anything about them and there difference. He just places a period or hashmark in front and leaves us to wonder!!!!! Very poooorrrrrr teaching. I have only gotten through two chapters and I have a sour taste in my mouth about this course. I have already looked to see if there was another one by another instructor

results.content:
I had a little knowledge of CSS but I wanted to learn more. This course promised to show me how to create awesome web sites using CSS, and it really delivered.

The lessons and examples were very clear, and if I got lost, I could download the files to see where I went wrong. 

The instructor was good at clearly explaining what he was doing, and I really liked his friendly way of teaching. 

This is one of the best courses I have taken on web design, and I look forward to any new courses that this instructor comes out with in the future.
results.content_html:
I had a little knowledge of CSS but I wanted to learn more. This course promised to show me how to create awesome web sites using CSS, and it really delivered.

The lessons and examples were very clear, and if I got lost, I could download the files to see where I went wrong.

The instructor was good at clearly explaining what he was doing, and I really liked his friendly way of teaching.

This is one of the best courses I have taken on web design, and I look forward to any new courses that this instructor comes out with in the future.

results.content: Prowadzący nie powinien wstawiać stylów bezpośrednio do kodu html. Może to skutkować złymi nawykami uczących się.

response.content: Hi Adamo. You're correct, adding CSS styles directly into HTML is generally a bad idea, and I talk about this a lot (as you know, you've pretty much finished the course!). But it's also a good way to demonstrate inline CSS and it's a great way to demonstrate to students how to apply CSS quickly. Additionally, sometimes it's easier to write inline CSS so you don't have to watch me flip between files and screens too much.
response.content_html: Hi Adamo. You're correct, adding CSS styles directly into HTML is generally a bad idea, and I talk about this a lot (as you know, you've pretty much finished the course!). But it's also a good way to demonstrate inline CSS and it's a great way to demonstrate to students how to apply CSS quickly. Additionally, sometimes it's easier to write inline CSS so you don't have to watch me flip between files and screens too much.

results.content_html: Prowadzący nie powinien wstawiać stylów bezpośrednio do kodu html. Może to skutkować złymi nawykami uczących się.

results.content:
In my opinion, it's a course the teacher has put up as a kind of an afterthough. It isn't the overall course structure, but the way the actual classes develop. They're like if you skim over a pocket reference book on CSS.

Also the teacher just try things without actually knowing beforehand what's going to be the result, or what's going on, in some kind of "random programming" pattern. It's like he doesn't master the subject, though I believe that's not the case.

I can't see it useful for absolute beginners as it lacks focus on basic concepts, but much less for people who have some knowledge because, on the contrary, it's too basic.
results.content_html:
In my opinion, it's a course the teacher has put up as a kind of an afterthough. It isn't the overall course structure, but the way the actual classes develop. They're like if you skim over a pocket reference book on CSS.

Also the teacher just try things without actually knowing beforehand what's going to be the result, or what's going on, in some kind of "random programming" pattern. It's like he doesn't master the subject, though I believe that's not the case.

I can't see it useful for absolute beginners as it lacks focus on basic concepts, but much less for people who have some knowledge because, on the contrary, it's too basic.

I already have Web Development experience. But I never did too much with CSS, so my web designs were always meh.
This course gave me tons of new knowledge and I already feel like a way better developer thanks to it!
But of course the most important part about taking a course is actually applying that knowledge, so I will use everything I learned here to create my own gorgeous design for CSSZenGarden.
It will be a great addition to my portfolio, thanks Kalob!

results.content: I recommend this course to everyone who wants to improve in CSS, it is very thorough.
results.content_html: I recommend this course to everyone who wants to improve in CSS, it is very thorough.

results.content: With Kalob Taulien at the wheel, you're receiving instruction from a guy with years of experience of actually doing this stuff in the trenches. That means, he not only knows his stuff, but also understands the relative importance of the million and one things which could appear in a course of this nature. This is not some guy who's read a book about CSS, maybe watched a bunch of videos on youtube, got a microphone for Christmas from his gran, and thought it'd be cool to make a course on udemy - this is a seasoned expert who can also teach. A few other things to bear in mind. This guy is not exactly renowned for filler. His content is concentrated and to the point. You will need to focus. You may need to play videos more than once. You will definitely need to practice. We all know those instructors on Udemy, and elsewhere for that matter, who fill up their courses with lame repetition and endless talking about what they're going to talk about. None of that with Mr Taulien. When it says the course is 13 hours long, that's what you get. Not 13 hours that could/should be edited down to maybe 6. His style of presentation is highly engaging. Unlike some instructors, he actually sounds interested in what he's teaching. He finds it fun. He definitely won't send you to sleep. And lastly, the guy is all over the questions in the Q&A section. Highly recommended.

results.content:
Short comment:
* Incredible course! You learn CSS3 from the ground up!

Long comment:
* This is a very motivating presentation of the topic CSS3 including responsive design.
* It is nicely structured and can therefore even be used as a lookup for topic details later when applying the learned skills to the real world!
* The learning curve is nicely tuned so everybody (who is willing to) can follow. The split up of general CSS lessons first and CSS3-specific lessons later helps a lot here as well!
* Great additional lesson content for those who want to work on the source code without typing everything themselves -> quick startup into the lesson!
* Nice quizzes and comprehensive projects at the end of a group of lessons
* very vivid and pleasant voice and always very professional and fitting to the subject, even when there are one or two nice little jokes hidden in the lessons ;-)
* I came only for the responsive part as I am not a CSS beginner, but I liked the fundamental lessons as well! :)

Good Job! Thank you!
results.content_html:

* The learning curve is nicely tuned so everybody (who is willing to) can follow. The split up of general CSS lessons first and CSS3-specific lessons later helps a lot here as well!
* Great additional lesson content for those who want to work on the source code without typing everything themselves -> quick startup into the lesson!
* Nice quizzes and comprehensive projects at the end of a group of lessons
* very vivid and pleasant voice and always very professional and fitting to the subject, even when there are one or two nice little jokes hidden in the lessons ;-)
* I came only for the responsive part as I am not a CSS beginner, but I liked the fundamental lessons as well! :)

Good Job! Thank you!
